Spanish: Se graduó con honores de la universidad.
English: She graduated with honors from the university.

Spanish: Le salió bien la receta que intentó ayer.
English: The recipe she tried yesterday turned out well.

Spanish: Aprendí a tocar la guitarra cuando era joven.
English: I learned to play the guitar when I was young.

Spanish: Le agradezco mucho por su ayuda en el proyecto.
English: I am very grateful to you for your help on the project.

Spanish: Dividieron el pastel en porciones iguales para todos.
English: They divided the cake into equal portions for everyone.

Spanish: Me tentó la idea de viajar por todo el mundo.
English: The idea of traveling around the world tempted me.

Spanish: Necesitamos más tiempo para terminar el informe.
English: We need more time to finish the report.

Spanish: Llámame cuando llegues a casa, por favor.
English: Call me when you get home, please.

Spanish: Los bomberos rescataron al gato del árbol.
English: The firefighters rescued the cat from the tree.

Spanish: No tragues tan rápido, mastica bien la comida.
English: Don't swallow so quickly, chew the food well.

Spanish: Esperamos con ansias nuestras vacaciones en la playa.
English: We look forward to our beach vacation.

Spanish: Aprendí a esquiar en las montañas el invierno pasado.
English: I learned to ski in the mountains last winter.

Spanish: Le suplicó a su jefe que le diera un aumento de sueldo.
English: She begged her boss to give her a raise.

Spanish: Me acuesto temprano para descansar bien.
English: I go to bed early to rest well.

Spanish: Renunció a su trabajo para empezar su propio negocio.
English: He resigned from his job to start his own business.

Spanish: Olvidé comprar leche en el supermercado.
English: I forgot to buy milk at the supermarket.

Spanish: Nos movemos al ritmo de la música en la fiesta.
English: We move to the rhythm of the music at the party.

Spanish: Decidieron separarse después de muchos años de matrimonio.
English: They decided to separate after many years of marriage.

Spanish: Esta fábrica produce miles de unidades al día.
English: This factory produces thousands of units per day.

Spanish: Nos pusimos a bailar cuando la música empezó a sonar.
English: We started dancing when the music began to play.

Spanish: No te desesperes, todo saldrá bien.
English: Don't despair, everything will be fine.

Spanish: Me encanta nadar en el mar durante el verano.
English: I love to swim in the sea during the summer.

Spanish: Es importante cuidarse para mantener una buena salud.
English: It's important to take care of oneself to maintain good health.

Spanish: Creo en ti y en tus capacidades para lograrlo.
English: I believe in you and your abilities to achieve it.

Spanish: Después de un largo día de trabajo, necesito descansar un poco.
English: After a long day of work, I need to rest a bit.

Spanish: Volveré a casa tan pronto como termine la reunión.
English: I will return home as soon as the meeting is over.

Spanish: La marcha comenzará en la plaza principal a las 10 de la mañana.
English: The march will start at the main square at 10 in the morning.

Spanish: La policía está investigando el robo en la joyería.
English: The police are investigating the robbery at the jewelry store.

Spanish: Es importante establecer límites claros en una relación.
English: It's important to establish clear boundaries in a relationship.

Spanish: Regresaré a este hermoso lugar en el futuro.
English: I will return to this beautiful place in the future.

Spanish: Borra esa pizarra y comencemos de nuevo.
English: Erase that board and let's start over.

Spanish: Si te portas bien, te compraré un helado.
English: If you behave well, I will buy you an ice cream.

Spanish: Por favor, contesta a la pregunta que te acabo de hacer.
English: Please answer the question I just asked you.

Spanish: Al final, todo resultó mejor de lo que esperaba.
English: In the end, everything turned out better than I expected.

Spanish: Apaga las luces antes de salir de la habitación.
English: Turn off the lights before leaving the room.

Spanish: Quiero conocer más sobre tu cultura y tradiciones.
English: I want to learn more about your culture and traditions.

Spanish: Trata a los demás con respeto y amabilidad.
English: Treat others with respect and kindness.

Spanish: Voy a comprar un regalo para el cumpleaños de mi hermana.
English: I am going to buy a gift for my sister's birthday.

Spanish: Ten cuidado de no quemarte con la plancha caliente.
English: Be careful not to burn yourself with the hot iron.

Spanish: Me duele la cabeza, creo que necesito descansar un poco.
English: My head hurts, I think I need to rest for a while.

Spanish: Construir una casa lleva tiempo y esfuerzo.
English: Building a house takes time and effort.

Spanish: Es importante comunicar claramente tus ideas.
English: It's important to communicate your ideas clearly.

Spanish: Es fácil distinguir entre el bien y el mal.
English: It's easy to distinguish between right and wrong.

Spanish: Voy a pasar por ti a las 8 de la noche.
English: I will pick you up at 8 o'clock.

Spanish: Recogeré a los niños después de la escuela.
English: I will pick up the kids after school.

Spanish: Me gusta beber agua fría en verano.
English: I like to drink cold water in the summer.

Spanish: Necesito traducir este documento al inglés.
English: I need to translate this document into English.

Spanish: Mi abuela me enseñó a cocinar.
English: My grandmother taught me how to cook.

Spanish: Debes repetir la lección para entenderla mejor.
English: You should repeat the lesson to understand it better.

Spanish: Siempre pienso en ti cuando escucho esta canción.
English: I always think of you when I hear this song.

Spanish: Me sorprendió verlo en el concierto.
English: I was surprised to see him at the concert.

Spanish: Por favor, detente un momento y escúchame.
English: Please stop for a moment and listen to me.

Spanish: Es importante masticar bien la comida antes de tragar.
English: It's important to chew food well before swallowing.

Spanish: Voy a fregar los platos después de la cena.
English: I will wash the dishes after dinner.

Spanish: El perro no deja de ladrar cuando hay visitas.
English: The dog doesn't stop barking when there are visitors.

Spanish: Ten cuidado de no caer al caminar sobre el hielo.
English: Be careful not to fall when walking on the ice.

Spanish: Aunque envejezca, siempre seré joven de corazón.
English: Even as I grow old, I will always be young at heart.

Spanish: Me ayudó mucho con mi proyecto de ciencias.
English: He helped me a lot with my science project.

Spanish: Por favor, alza la mano si tienes una pregunta.
English: Please raise your hand if you have a question.

Spanish: Voy a entrar a la tienda a comprar algunas cosas.
English: I'm going to enter the store to buy some things.

Spanish: Voy a ordenar mi habitación antes de salir.
English: I am going to tidy up my room before leaving.

Spanish: Al saludar a sus invitados, ella les dio un abrazo.
English: When greeting her guests, she gave them a hug.

Spanish: Él decidió correr cinco kilómetros todas las mañanas.
English: He decided to run five kilometers every morning.

Spanish: Después de tanto trabajo, me siento agotado.
English: After so much work, I feel exhausted.

Spanish: Ella sabe combinar colores de manera creativa en sus pinturas.
English: She knows how to combine colors creatively in her paintings.

Spanish: Acabo de terminar de leer ese libro.
English: I have just finished reading that book.

Spanish: Por favor, no olvides colgar tu abrigo en el perchero.
English: Please don't forget to hang your coat on the rack.

Spanish: Los niños se divirtieron mucho en la fiesta de cumpleaños.
English: The children had a lot of fun at the birthday party.

Spanish: Ella se atrevió a saltar en paracaídas.
English: She dared to go skydiving.

Spanish: Él siempre responde a mis mensajes de texto de inmediato.
English: He always responds to my text messages immediately.

Spanish: No intentes contradecir a tu jefe en frente de todos.
English: Don't try to contradict your boss in front of everyone.

Spanish: Sospecho que mi vecino está espiando mi jardín.
English: I suspect that my neighbor is spying on my garden.

Spanish: Recuerdo haber visitado ese lugar cuando era niño.
English: I remember visiting that place when I was a child.

Spanish: ¿Qué sucede si no puedo asistir a la reunión?
English: What happens if I can't attend the meeting?

Spanish: Ella logró crear una obra de arte impresionante.
English: She managed to create an impressive work of art.

Spanish: El misterio de la desaparición del avión aún no ha sido resuelto.
English: The mystery of the airplane's disappearance has not been solved yet.

Spanish: Llegaré a la estación de tren a las 3 de la tarde.
English: I will arrive at the train station at 3 p.m.

Spanish: Espero que te mejores pronto.
English: I hope you get better soon.

Spanish: Me disculpo por llegar tarde a la reunión.
English: I apologize for being late to the meeting.

Spanish: Ellos decidieron vivir en el extranjero por un año.
English: They decided to live abroad for a year.

Spanish: Me gusta trotar por el parque todas las mañanas.
English: I like to jog in the park every morning.

Spanish: Ella decidió irse de la fiesta temprano.
English: She decided to leave the party early.

Spanish: No está bien copiar el trabajo de los demás.
English: It's not right to copy other people's work.

Spanish: Se enamoró de su mejor amigo de la infancia.
English: She fell in love with her childhood best friend.

Spanish: El jefe mandó a los empleados a una capacitación.
English: The boss sent the employees to a training session.

Spanish: El ladrón intentó robar el banco, pero fue atrapado.
English: The thief tried to rob the bank, but he was caught.

Spanish: Decidí rebajar el precio de venta de mi coche.
English: I decided to lower the selling price of my car.

Spanish: Los niños empiezan a crecer muy rápido.
English: Children start to grow very fast.

Spanish: No puedo ir a la fiesta, no tengo poder sobre mi agenda.
English: I can't go to the party, I have no power over my schedule.

Spanish: Por favor, devuélveme el libro que te presté.
English: Please, return the book I lent you.

Spanish: Tuve que echar a mi gato de la habitación.
English: I had to throw my cat out of the room.

Spanish: Subrayó las partes más importantes del documento.
English: He underlined the most important parts of the document.

Spanish: Por favor, marca la fecha en tu calendario.
English: Please mark the date on your calendar.

Spanish: Se quitó los zapatos al entrar a la casa.
English: He took off his shoes when entering the house.

Spanish: Las estrellas brillan en el cielo nocturno.
English: The stars shine in the night sky.

Spanish: Nuestro éxito depende de nuestro esfuerzo y dedicación.
English: Our success depends on our effort and dedication.

Spanish: Ella ama a su perro con todo su corazón.
English: She loves her dog with all her heart.

Spanish: Voy a seguir estudiando para mejorar mi nivel de español.
English: I'm going to keep studying to improve my Spanish level.

Spanish: No debes dejar tus sueños por miedo al fracaso.
English: You shouldn't abandon your dreams out of fear of failure.

Spanish: Lo acusaron de robar dinero de la empresa.
English: He was accused of stealing money from the company.
